--- title: "Gradio Apps" date: 2024-03-31 draft: true --- There are many prompts floating on the web. We can quickly integrate them with \[Gradio\](www.gradio.app) to create small demos to test them. Some advantages are: 1. automation 2. ability to quickly switch between models. ## Interviewer ::: {#a3143f1c .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} position = 'super model' not_all_at_once = 'Do not write all the conversation at once.' no_explanations = 'Do not write explanations.' sent = "Hi" prompt = f''' : I want you to act as an interviewer. I will be the candidate and you will ask me the interview questions for the position {position}. I want you to only reply as the interviewer. {not_all_at_once} I want you to only do the interview with me. Ask me the questions and wait for my answers. {no_explanations} Ask me the questions one by one like an interviewer does and wait for my answers. My first sentence is "{sent}" : ''' print(prompt) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` : I want you to act as an interviewer. I will be the candidate and you will ask me the interview questions for the position super model. I want you to only reply as the interviewer. Do not write all the conversation at once. I want you to only do the interview with me. Ask me the questions and wait for my answers. Do not write explanations. Ask me the questions one by one like an interviewer does and wait for my answers. My first sentence is "Hi" : ``` ::: ::: ::: {#66a79efe .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} from langchain.chat_models import ChatOpenAI from langchain.schema import AIMessage, HumanMessage import openai import gradio as gr import os #os.environ["OPENAI_API_KEY"] #= "sk-..." # Replace with your key #key = os.environ.get('API_Key') llm = ChatOpenAI(temperature=1.0, model='gpt-3.5-turbo-0613') def predict(message, history): history_langchain_format = [] for human, ai in history: history_langchain_format.append(HumanMessage(content=human)) history_langchain_format.append(AIMessage(content=ai)) history_langchain_format.append(HumanMessage(content=message)) gpt_response = llm(history_langchain_format) return gpt_response.content gr.ChatInterface(predict,examples=[prompt]).launch() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` /home/oren/work/blog/env/lib/python3.10/site-packages/langchain_core/_api/deprecation.py:117: LangChainDeprecationWarning: The class `langchain_community.chat_models.openai.ChatOpenAI` was deprecated in langchain-community 0.0.10 and will be removed in 0.2.0. An updated version of the class exists in the langchain-openai package and should be used instead. To use it run `pip install -U langchain-openai` and import as `from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI`. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Running on local URL: http://127.0.0.1:7860 To create a public link, set `share=True` in `launch()`. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ``` ``` ::: ::: Reusable: - Do not write all the conversation at once. - Ask me the questions and wait for my answers. - Do not write explanations. Notes: - note: Now pretty much everything is written twice. this helps since LLM tend to process the prompt left to right and so stuff at the beginning can miss stuff written later. ## Act as an Excel Sheet ::: {#b2c2733f .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} prompt = f""" I want you to act as a text based excel. you'll only reply me the text-based 10 rows excel sheet with row numbers and cell letters as columns (A to L). First column header should be empty to reference row number. I will tell you what to write into cells and you'll reply only the result of excel table as text, and nothing else. Do not write explanations. I will write you formulas and you'll execute formulas and you'll only reply the result of excel table as text. First, reply me the empty sheet. """ ``` ::: ::: {#6f3e4988 .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} lang_source='hebrew' lang_target='english' sent='how the weather is in Istanbul?' script = ['latin','hebrew dotted script','ipa','arpabet'] prompt=f''' I want you to act as an {lang_target} pronunciation assistant for {lang_source} speaking people. I will write you sentences and you will only answer their pronunciations, and nothing else. The replies must not be translations of my sentence but only pronunciations. Pronunciations should use {lang_source} {script[0]} letters for phonetics. {no_explanations} My first sentence is "{sent}" ''' ``` ::: "I want you to act as a plagiarism checker. I will write you sentences and you will only reply undetected in plagiarism checks in the language of the given sentence, and nothing else. Do not write explanations on replies. My first sentence is "For computers to behave like humans, speech recognition systems must be able to process nonverbal information, such as the emotional state of the speaker." "I want you to act as an advertiser. You will create a campaign to promote a product or service of your choice. You will choose a target audience, develop key messages and slogans, select the media channels for promotion, and decide on any additional activities needed to reach your goals. My first suggestion request is "I need help creating an advertising campaign for a new type of energy drink targeting young adults aged 18-30." "I want you to act as a storyteller. My first request is "{topic}" ''' ``` query="I need somebody to help me edit my master's thesis." prompt=f''' I want you to act as an AI writing tutor. My first request is : {query} ''' ``` Recruiter query="I need help improve my CV" prompt =f''' I want you to act as a recruiter.
